text: What kind of folder structure do you'll use to digitally  organize random code-bits and  coding projects?

elements.text: What kind of folder structure do you'll use to digitally  organize random code-bits and  coding projects?

text:
I'm convering upon
```~/OneDrive/Code
├── .Archive  # archived projects no longer active 
├── 0 Playground   # random code playing around with that's not totally random
├── 1 Scratch  # random junk code that I can probably safely get rid of
├── 3 Notes  # mic. notes and tips 
├── 4 Repos  # repos copied form github etc.
├── 5 Resources  # resources related to code and downloads of projects etc.
├── Project 1   # active project 1
└── Project 2  # another active project```

elements.text:
~/OneDrive/Code
├── .Archive  # archived projects no longer active 
├── 0 Playground   # random code playing around with that's not totally random
├── 1 Scratch  # random junk code that I can probably safely get rid of
├── 3 Notes  # mic. notes and tips 
├── 4 Repos  # repos copied form github etc.
├── 5 Resources  # resources related to code and downloads of projects etc.
├── Project 1   # active project 1
└── Project 2  # another active project

text: I just looked at Dr Watson a few hours ago. Looks like a good layout.

elements.text: I just looked at Dr Watson a few hours ago. Looks like a good layout.

text: But that's for a julia project. I'm discussing general digital files.
